title: Analysis of HBV data
text: vignette demonstrate usage DiagnoDating dataset Hepatitis B virus (HBV) published Zoe Patterson Ross et al (2018). data example can loaded using command data(HBV). load environment object phy phylogeny constructed using PhyML. perform dating, also need know dates samples. stored labels tips phylogeny, can extracted follows:
code: library(DiagnoDating,quietly=T) set.seed(1) data(HBV) dates=as.numeric(gsub(".*_","",phy$tip.label)) names(dates)=phy$tip.label

title: Analysis of HBV data
text: Let us perform dating analysis using BactDating additive relaxed clock model (ARC):
code: r=runDating(unroot(phy),dates,model='arc') print(r) ## Result from BactDating, model arc, clock rate 0.29, relaxation parameter 27.75, root date 1158.83

title: Analysis of HBV data
text: posterior predictive check satisfied:  residual analysis also satisfied:
code: ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) ## [1] 0.008 ps=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T) ## The posterior distribution of p-values has median 0.00 and 99.70% of values below 5%

title: Analysis of simulated data
text: start generating dated tree structure small effective population size Neg=1N_e g=1 year relative sampling frame 10 years 2010 2020:  Next generate phylogenetic tree using additive clock model (ARC) parameters 10 5:  root--tip regression analysis works quite well:
code: library(DiagnoDating,quietly=T) set.seed(1) dates=runif(100,2010,2020) dt=simcoaltree(dates,alpha=1) plot(dt,show.tip.label = F) axisPhylo(backward = F) tree=simobsphy(dt,mu=10,sigma=5,model='arc') plot(tree,show.tip.label = F) axisPhylo(1,backward=F) res=roottotip(tree,dates)

title: Analysis of simulated data
text: Let us first run analysis using incorrect Poisson clock model instead correct ARC model. can see issues using posterior predictive check:  can also see issues performing residual analysis:
code: r=runDating(unroot(tree),dates,model='poisson') print(r) ## Result from BactDating, model poisson, clock rate 10.61, relaxation parameter 0.00, root date 2008.69 ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) ## [1] 0.004 ps=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T) ## The posterior distribution of p-values has median 0.00 and 100.00% of values below 5%

title: Analysis of simulated data
text: Let us now perform dating correct ARC clock model: posterior predictive check satisfied:  residual analysis also satisfied:
code: r=runDating(unroot(tree),dates,model='arc') print(r) ## Result from BactDating, model arc, clock rate 11.40, relaxation parameter 6.34, root date 2008.81 ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) ## [1] 0.2 ps=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T) ## The posterior distribution of p-values has median 0.56 and 3.10% of values below 5%

title: Using DiagnoDating on your own data
text: first required input (let’s call t) phylogenetic tree class phylo ape package, can loaded Newick Nexus file using respectively following commands ape package: tree branch lengths measured units substitutions. words, branch lengths measured substitutions per site. sure whether branch lengths measured correctly , try compute sum(t$edge.length). total number substitutions throughout tree, get value one even bit one, branch lengths probably correct unit. branch branch lengths measured per site, need rescale using command: L number sites used build tree.
code: library(ape) t=read.tree('filename.nwk') t=read.nexus('filename.nex') t$edge.length=t$edge.length*L

title: Using DiagnoDating on your own data
text: second required input (let’s call d) dates isolates sampled. Dates need expressed decimal years, example 2015.5 means 1st July 2015. needed, can convert decimal years date formats using decimal_date function lubridate package. input can simply vector decimal dates, case order needs order tree tips t$tip.label. example, t$tip.label (,B,C) d=c(2010,2011,2012) indicates isolated 2010, B 2011 C 2012. Alternatively, vector d ordered names(d) corresponds tip names. example, d=c(2011,2010,2012)names(d)=c('B','','C') meaning previous example. isolation dates unknown, can indicated using NA vector, case date considered unknown within range known dates, ie range return command range(d,na.rm=T).

title: Using DiagnoDating on your own data
text: two inputs t d described correct format, ready run dating analysis using main command: Note several optional arguments command can useful, select dating algorithm use, clock model, whether tree rooted estimated, whether rate known estimated. details see help(runDating)
code: library(DiagnoDating) r=runDating(t,d)

what: Computing diagnostics on the dating analysis
title: Using DiagnoDating on your own data
text: can perform posterior predictive check using command: can see likelihood branch using command: can compute residuals follows: can compute posterior distribution residual p-values follows:
code: p=ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) plotLikBranches(r) plotResid(r) p=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T)

what: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenies in microbial population genetics
title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenies in microbial population genetics
text: aim package diagnose results phylogeny dating analysis. Many tools exist produce dated phylogenies, several factors can invalidate results. includes confounding effect population structure can dating. also includes incorrect assumptions made running dating analysis, example using inappropriate clock model, accounting recombination, etc.

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenies in microbial population genetics
text: can install DiagnoDating github : package can loaded using:
code: devtools::install_github("xavierdidelot/DiagnoDating") library(DiagnoDating,quietly=T)

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenies in microbial population genetics
text: basic example usage. First generate dated tree 10 samples 2000 2020:  Next generate phylogenetic tree using Poisson(10) mutation model, perform root--tip analysis:  can run dating analysis phylogeny follows:  can perform posterior predictive check:  can see likelihood branch:  can compute residuals:  can compute posterior distribution residual p-values:
code: dates=runif(10,2000,2020) dt=simcoaltree(dates) plot(dt) axisPhylo(backward=F) phy=simobsphy(dt,mu=10,model='poisson') r=roottotip(phy,dates) r=runDating(phy,dates) plot(r) p=ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) plotLikBranches(r) plotResid(r) p=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T) #> The posterior distribution of p-values has median 0.58 and 4.40% of values below 5%

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenies in microbial population genetics
text: detailed examples use DiagnoDating, see vignettes . See also help included package using R command help(package='DiagnoDating'). problem question please create issue get touch emailing xavier.didelot@gmail.com
